choices: He finds some of the others fighting a monster
He gets there and introduces himself in sailor moon-style without thinking
12521.content:
As the flash of light died down, Ichigo found himself no longer in the room at Urahara's shop that he had been in. He was now outdoors. "Huh? How did I get out here?" he asked outloud. He also noticed that the others weren't around. He saw that he was in an unfamilliar city that didn't look like Karakura town.

He then felt a breeze on his legs, and when he looked down to discover why, he was met with the biggest shock of his life. No longer in his school uniform, he was now dressed in the most rediculous thing he had ever worn. He now wore a seifuku style white uniform with a very short blue skirt, and a red bow in front. He also had a red choker with a crescent moon on the front, and wore white gloves that went up to his elbows and red heeled boots that went up to his knees. And though he couldn't see it, there was a gold tiara on his forehead.

"What the hell am I wearing!?" he said with a tone that reflected just how shocked he was. But before he could wonder further, there was a loud crash, and he heard screams, and instictively ran towards the source.
12521.title: Ichigo fights evil in the name of the moon

choices: The Straw Hats swap lives with characters from another anime
13.content: Ok then, who is gonna swap lives? Or maybe, all of the Straw Hats will swap lives with characters from a different anime.
13.title: One Piece

choices: Luffy and Robin switch lives, but only Luffy notices
Luffy and Robin switch lives, but the rest of the crew doesn't notice
131.content:
"Hey, guys!"

Luffy ran back to the Thousand Sunny to show his crew something he'd found while exploring the island they'd just landed on.

Nami looked up and said, "Good timing, Luffy. The log pose is reset, and we're ready to go."

"Hey, check out what I found!"

Luffy held his hands out so the crew could see a necklace. The jewel in the center of the necklace was blue while everything else was gold.

"What a beautiful necklace!" Nami said, her eyes glued to the jewel in front.

"It's in incredible shape," Robin said, taking a close look at the necklace. "I'd imagine it's at least a few hundred years old."

"Why'd you take that, anyway?" Zoro asked. "I don't see anything special about it."

"Yeah, I was going to leave it behind," Luffy admitted, "but the jewel wasn't always blue. When I found it, it was clear, like a diamond. It didn't turn blue until after I had put it on."

"Well, I have read that the people of this island made jewelry that could perform extraordinary feats," Robin said. "This necklace might be one of those special pieces of jewelry."

"You're saying that this necklace could be some super-weapon?" Franky asked.

"If it is, keep that thing away from me!" Usopp said as he backed away from the group.

"Calm down," Sanji said. "We won't know if it's harmless or not unless someone tests it out."

"I'd be dying to know if this is dangerous or not...but I'm already dead!" Brook joked, to the annoyance of most of the crew.

"Who would want to try something that could be dangerous?" Chopper asked, from the same spot Usopp was taking cover.

"I'll do it, Doctor," Robin said, taking the necklace from Luffy and getting ready to put it over her neck. Nami groaned that she missed her chance to wear the necklace. As Robin put on the necklace, a bright light blinded the crew.
131.title: Luffy

1312.content:
As the light died down, Luffy opened his eyes and was greeted with a strange sight.

Standing in front of him was Robin, but she was dressed in his outfit. She had his red shirt over her torso, but closed in the front to cover her breasts. She had his shorts on her legs, tied with a yellow sash, while his sandals adorned her feet. Lastly, she had Luffy's straw hat on her head.

Luffy took a look at himself, noticing that he was now wearing Robin's clothes. He found his chest covered with Robin's purple top and his legs covered with her sarong skirt. Her high-heeled sandals covered his feet while his stomach remained exposed for the crew to see. Instead of his straw hat on his head, Luffy found Robin's sunglasses.

Luffy and Robin noticed their clothes had changed, like Luffy's clothes were made to fit Robin's body perfectly and vice versa. Also, both had the necklace around their necks, raising further questions in the Straw Hat Pirates' archaeologist.

Before she could voice her opinions, Chopper let out a groan. "All that necklace did was replicate itself and put the copy on Luffy. What a let down!"

"I'll say," Usopp added. "I expected something more dramatic."

Robin cautiously asked Sanji, "Is that really all the necklace did?"

Sanji blew some smoke from his cigarette out of his mouth and said, "Afraid so, Luffy. You found a dud."

Sanji's remark made Robin's heart skip a beat. "Luffy? He called me Luffy? Is it possible that..."

"What do you mean by 'dud,' Sanji?" Nami interrupted. "Luffy might have found a goldmine! If this thing can replicate itself every time it's worn, then we can sell the replicas at a market and make a fortune!"

"Alright, that's enough," Zoro said. "We've got no more business on this island, so let's just go."

"Yeah. I'm getting creeped out here," Luffy said.

"Wow!" Nami said to Luffy. "I think that's the first time I've seen you creeped out by something, Robin."

Luffy asked, "Robin? What are you talking about? I'm--"

Luffy was cut off by Robin covering his mouth and saying, "Set sail for the next island. I need to talk with Robin for a while." Without another word, Robin left the confused crew on deck while she dragged Luffy to the Aquarium Bar.

Nami, taking charge of the situation, said, "You heard Luffy, people! Let's get going!"

(At the Aquarium Bar)

"Why'd you stop me, Robin?" Luffy complained. "I was just going to tell Nami--"

"Who you really are. I know, but she wouldn't believe you," Robin said.

"What do you mean?"

"Somehow, this necklace forced us to switch lives with each other; and, from what I observed, the rest of the crew doesn't seem to notice. I think they believe I'm really you and you're really me."

"That's crazy! How can I be anyone else but me?"

Seeing she'd need to prove her point, Robin said, "Luffy, please wait right here. I'll be right back."

Watching Robin walk out of the bar, Luffy got an uneasy feeling in his stomach, but decided to ignore it. After a few minutes, Robin returned, but she looked different.
1312.title: New Roster

choices: "Let's find out more about these things!"
"Let's have some fun with these things!"
13122.content:
Luffy could make out that Robin was now wearing Nami's clothes. Nami's bikini top was covering her breasts while Nami's jeans proudly showed Robin's hips. Strangely enough, she even had Nami's tattoo on her left shoulder. However, Robin still wore the necklace around her necklace.

"Wow! How'd you get Nami to give you her clothes?" Luffy asked.

"I didn't. I just put this necklace around her neck," Robin said. "Come here, I'd like to show you something."

Luffy followed Robin outside and looked over to where she pointed. There she saw Nami standing on the deck, but wearing Luffy's clothes. She was grinning from ear to ear and looking toward the sea. Luffy noticed that, unlike last time, Nami wasn't wearing a necklace around her neck.

Nami looked up to Zoro and shouted, "Hey, when are we gonna set sail? I want to go on a new adventure now!"

"Calm down, Luffy," Zoro shouted back. "These things take time, you know."

Nami pouted, then looked over at Robin and Luffy and, with a happy smile, waved and said, "Hey, Robin! Hey, Nami! Done with your girl time, already?"

Robin walked up to Nami and said, "Actually we just started. Isn't that right, Robin?"

"Uh, right, Nami," Luffy said, playing along with Robin.

"Okay," Nami said. "Just don't spend too much time with each other. We're all friends, so you need to spend some time with the rest of us."

"Understood, Luffy," Robin and Luffy said, almost in unison. With that, Nami walked away to talk with the other crew members.

Robin turned to Luffy and said, "Get what's going on now?"

Luffy said, "I think so." Robin leaned in closer, hoping that her captain had uncovered the secret of the necklace.

"You and Nami are playing a game with me where we all act like each other for a day! We should get the rest of the crew involved in this game; it's so fun!"

After a brief moment of disappointment, Robin said, "Luffy, this isn't a game. Right now, as far as the crew is concerned, you really are me, I really am Miss Navigator, and Miss Navigator is really you."

"How's that even possible?"

"It's because of these necklaces," Robin said, lifting her and Luffy's necklace. "Somehow, these necklaces allow us to switch lives with any person who puts this on. Why it copied itself when I put it on is still a mystery to me, but these things are responsible for the predicament we're in."

Luffy thought about the situation for a while, then came up with an idea.
13122.title: A New Captain

choices: Luffy uses the necklace to switch him and Nami
Robin convinces Luffy to stay like he is
131222.content:
"With these necklaces, we can have a whole lot of fun with the crew!"

"Hold on, Luffy!" Robin said, struggling to keep herself from yelling. "We still don't know what these things do exactly. I'd like you to hold off on using them until we can find out more information about them. Don't use them on anyone else, please!"

Luffy, seeing Robin's distress about the situation, said, "Okay, I'll wait until we learn more."

"Thank you, Luffy," Robin said. She then started to blush and added, "Well, it's getting late. We...should get ready for bed."

"Okay, see you in the morning!" Luffy said as he made his way to the men's quarters.

"Where do you think you're going?" Robin asked frantically.

"To my bed, where I always sleep," Luffy responded, oblivious to Robin's worry.

"Luffy, the crew thinks you're me, so you have to sleep in my bed," Robin told him, ignoring her blush.

"What? But men can't go in your and Nami's room!"

"Technically, this room belongs to you and me now."

"What about Nami?"

"She's going to be sleeping in your bunk until this switch is undone. Nobody else will find anything strange about it, so please don't make a fuss about it."

Luffy thought about Nami sleeping with the guys and panicked. "I can't go through with this! Nami needs to sleep in her own bed, not mine!"
131222.title: "Let's have some fun with these things!"

1312222.content:
"Luffy, wait!" Robin nearly yelled, dragging Luffy into the women's quarters before anyone else noticed.

"Let me go!" Luffy yelled.

"Luffy, listen to me!" Robin told her captain. "No one else notices the changes but us! To everyone else, Nami will look like Luffy, talk like Luffy, think like Luffy; Nami has become Monkey D. Luffy! And in that same regard, I have become Nami and you have become Nico Robin!"

Luffy finally calmed down enough to listen to what Robin was saying.

"In everyone else's eyes, Nami is going to look like you, so she's not going to feel awkward around the boys. Trust me, Luffy, nothing is going to happen. The best thing for us to do right now is stay together until we can figure out what the hell these necklaces are!"

Luffy turned away from Robin and said, "...fine. I'll go along with this."

"Thank you, Luffy. Now, why don't we get to sleep?"

Luffy felt really uncomfortable slipping into Robin's bed to get to sleep. "I don't like this. My bunk is more comfortable."

"This is strange for me too, Luffy, but there's very little we can do," Robin said as she laid down in Nami's bed. "Let's just hope that nothing bad happens until we can get our answers."

Luffy and Robin got as comfortable as they could and drifted off to sleep.

choices: The wish ended up affecting other people as well
1542122121.content:
Trunks was upset. His father, Vegeta wouldn't pay any attention to Trunks at all. The only thing Vegeta seemed to care about was training, and trying to be oh so superior to Goku. Trunks thought that maybe by learning how to go super saiyan his father would be proud, but alas it was for naught.

Trunks tightened his orange karate belt before sitting down on the floor.

'Just a typical day at the Capsule Corp Training facility.' Trunks thought to himself before frowning. Trunks tugged at his orange wristbands before allowing them to snap back.

'How can I-' Trunks began to think before he brought out of his musing by a loud voice.

"Woman!" the loud voice shouted. "What are you doing with the Dragonballs!"

'Dragonballs' The lavendar haired youth thought.

Trunks knew the sound of that voice. Trunks got off the ground, and made his way to his door carefully whipping off whatever dirt was on his hands on his dark green gi. Trunks carefully peeked his head out oh the door to spot his mother, and father in the hallway.

Bulma was in her typical red dress, and yellow scarf wrapped around her neck. Her bluish green hair was more frazzled than usual. Trunks could tell his mother was annoyed from the way she was tapping her yellow shoes against the floor.

Vegeta always wore his blue tank top, and his skintight spandex pants. His black spiked hair had a way of making Vegeta look intimidating to Trunks. Vegeta's fingers were practically twitching underneath his white gloves.

"Look" Bulma took a deep breath before continuing. "There is always someone willing to use these Dragonballs for selfish ends."

Bulma took a step forward getting in Vegeta's personal space before putting her hands on her hips.

"It's in everyone's best interest that we can keep them in our hands than theirs." Bulma finished.

Vegeta huffed before crossing his arms.

"Whatever. It doesn't concern me in the slightest." Vegeta stated before making his way towards Trunks.

Trunks immediately moved out of his father's way by moving out of the door into the hall. Vegeta stopped at the door, and turned his head to a acknowledge Trunks.

"Boy." Vegeta stated simply. "If you have time gawking than you have time to train."

Vegeta made his way into the training room. Trunks bit back a response before looking down at the floor. The sound of the door closing filled the hallway. Trunks then felt a hand on his shoulder.

"Hey." Trunks looked up to see his mother."Are you okay?"

Trunks turned his head away from his mother.

"I'm Fine." Trunks grumbled.

"Are you sure?" Bulma inquired.

"Yes!" Trunks stated hastily before running down the hall.

"Trunks! Wait!" Bulma yelled, but it was to late as Trunks already disappeared down the corridor. Bulma simply turned to face the training facility, and frowned.

Trunks wasn't paying attention to where he was going he just wanted to be away from his mother. Trunks made his way through the nearest door before stopping. Trunks looking around to see if he followed by Bulma, and when the coast was clear he let out a sigh of relief.

Suddenly light hit Trunk's eyes the and he made a move to cover them. As Trunks eyes adjusted he realized that he was outside in the courtyard. Trunks noticed that whatever was trying to blind him wasn't the sun.

"The Dragonballs!'Trunks thought.

Trunks slowly made his way to them.

'Wait.' Trunks stopped in his tracks. 'I should leave. I shouldn't-'

The Dragonballs glowed softly. Trunks found himself staring at the orange orbs. A thought crossed Trunks' mind.

'I can get whatever I want with this.' Trunks thought. 'I can get Father's respect.'

Trunks smiled deviously.

"ALMIGHTY SHENRON!" Trunks shouted. "ARISE!"

As soon as those words were spoken light sprung from the Dragonballs entering the sky. The sky turned dark as green, and yellow scales poked their way through the sky before a all to familiar snout popped through the clouds.

"I AM SHENRON THE ETERNAL DRAGON!" The ancient dragon bellowed. "STATE YOUR WISH SO I MAY GRANT IT!"

Trunks couldn't help, but blurt out. "I wish I was someone who held my father's utmost respect!"

"That wish is a simple matter!" The dragon stated as his eyes glowed.

As the glowing light engulfed Trunks' smile widened. The Light remained there only for a second before fading away leaving a man in Trunks' place. That man was now wearing the same dark green gi, orange wristbands, and orange karate as Trunks once did. That man was Goku, and boy was he confused.

"What?" Goku question. "Where am I?"

"TRUNKS!" a woman shouted.

Goku turned to face a very angry Bulma. Before Goku could get out a word Bulma reached out to grab his ear pulling it hard.

"OW!" Goku shouted in pain. "OW!"

"What were you thinking young man!" Bulma exclaimed.

Bulma immediately faced the dragon. "There will be no wishes today!"

Shenron simply huffed. "SO BE IT!"

Light engulfed the dragon before he faded from exsistance. The Dragonballs floated up in the sky before shooting off to the far corners of earth.

Bulma turned her attention to Goku. "Trunks! You are in so much trouble!"
1542122121.title: A wish using the Dragonballs

choices: The wish ended up affecting other people as well
15421221211.content:
"Wait! Bul-" Goku tried to get out before Bulma pulled his ear hard.

"No excuses!" Bulma never let go of that ear as she led Goku into Capsule Corp. Goku could only try not to stumble over his steps while unwillingly following Bulma. Bulma stopped in front of an unfamiliar door to Goku.

Bulma simply pressed a switch on the side of the door. Goku peered over Bulma's shoulder to see a very annoyed sweaty Vegeta. Vegeta had long, but discarded his tank top leaving him shirtless.

"Woman!" Vegeta shouted. "Why are you interrupting my training!."

Bulma without even missing a beat. "Because your son just attempted to use the Dragonballs!"

'Wait Son?!' Goku thought. 'This is insane!'

Vegeta's eyes widen for only a moment before his gaze honed in on Goku. Vegeta gaze very quickly became a glare.

Goku opened his mouth to speak only to be interrupted by Vegeta.

"Silence! Brat!" Vegeta demanded.

Goku couldn't help but shut his mouth. Ordinary the taller man would have bit back with a response, but Vegeta's body language just screamed at him to be quite.

Bulma let go off Goku's ear allowing him to stand up. Goku could only watch as Vegeta grabbed the folding chair in the corner of the room, and brought it just close enough to the pair. Vegeta sat in the chair.

"Come here." Vegeta said calmly.

Goku looked at Bulma for support only to be met with her glare. Goku looked so hurt as he slowly made his way to Vegeta.

"Undue your belt." Vegeta instructed.

Goku looked down to notice what he was wearing. Nearly gaping at the sight off articles of clothing. However, unfortunately for him Goku didn't have time to really soak it in as Vegeta growled.

"Undue your belt."

Goku hastily undid the karate belt. The lower part of the gi slid right down to his ankles revealing. Goku could only stare at new white briefs with the capsule corp logo on the waistband that now covered his nether regions.

"Lay down on my lap."

At the next instruction Goku realized exactly what was going to happen. Goku turned to run only to be tripped up by the lower part off the gii. Goku felt himself land on something hard. Goku looked up to see Vegeta's face. Goku was now laying Vegeta's lap. Vegeta laid his left hand on Goku's back to hold him in his lap. Vegeta raised his right hand.

"No! Please! I not-" Goku tried to get out.

The right hand hit Goku in the buttocks leaving a painful sting

smack

"Count" Vegeta instructed.

"I-" Goku tried to get out.

"COUNT!" Vegeta Shouted.

smack

Goku could only find himself think about the ludicrousness of the situation. Here he was in his rival's slap being treated like his son, and is now being punished like a bratty child.

'This has to be a bad dream.' Goku thought.

Goku didn't have time to think as Vegeta continued his punishment.

smack

"I SAID COUNT BRAT!" Vegeta shouted.

smack

"O-One"Goku gasped out shakily.

This continued on, and on due Goku eventually miscounted restarting said punishment again. By the time Goku successfully counted it had reached night time, and Goku's bum was so red that the backside of those white briefs appeared pink.

"Get up Brat!" Vegeta instructed.

Goku slowly got up off Vegeta's lap. Goku pulled the lower part of the gi up, and retied it with the karate belt. Goku shakily made his way to the door.

"Oh no you don't mister!" Bulma grabbed Goku's ear again.

Letting out a pained groan Goku let Bulma lead him out of the training room. Eventually the two reached a different room entirely. The room was the epitome of a kid's room. Toy's littered the floor, and the dresser. Some posters of the latest superhero hung around the walls of the bed. A train set was set up on the rug.

Bulma marched over to the dresser and pulled out a t-shirt with Hercule Satan face, and an identical briefs to what he was wearing. Goku didn't comment on the fact that he wasn't her son, or the clothes looked sized to fit him even though he was clearly an adult.

'It just has to be a dream right?' Goku thought.

"Your going right to bed." Bulma stated exhaustedly. "I'm going discuss this with your father."

Bulma turned to look at Goku.

"Good night."

Bulma left the room.

Goku could only stare at the spot Bulma was at. Goku stood there unmoving before reluctantly stripped out of the gi, and put on the clothes Bulma left for him. Hot tears left Goku's face as he made his way over to the bed. Goku immediately wrapped himself around the blankets and laid his head on the side of the pillow.

Slowly closed Goku eyes. Trying desperately to stop the tears.

"Please let this nightmare end." Goku said to himself before going to sleep.

15431.content:
It was another seemingly ordinary day at North High, and for the members of the SOS Brigade, which only meant one thing: Haruhi was bored out of her mind. She let out a bored grunt as she leaned her head on her palm in front of the brigade's computer. She, Kyon, and Yuki were the only ones currently present in the club room, with Itsuki and Mikuru already having left. Kyon sat at the table, while Yuki was reading in the corner as usual.

Against his better judgement, Kyon decided to ask her what was bothering her. "So whats got you down this time?"

"Ugh, its just been so boring around here lately." she replied.

He figured as much. "Well, what can you do? Life is just like that sometimes." he said, hoping to discourage her from whatever she might be wishing this time. Those never ended well.

"Hey Kyon, have you ever wondered what it would be like to be someone else?" Haruhi asked after a few minutes of silence.

"Well, I guess. I'm sure everyone has thought about it at one point or another." he responded.

"I mean, our lives is so dull. Nothing really interesting ever really happens to us."

'Oh how wrong you are...' Kyon thought.

"Right now I really wish I had someone else's life. Its gotta be more interesting than mine." she said. After another few minutes of silence, Haruh stood up. "I'm heading home. See you tomorrow."

"See ya." Kyon replied. At this point, the only other person left in the room was Yuki, so Kyon decided to head home as well. No point staying much longer. As he stood up, he looked over to Yuki, who was looking up from her book at him.

"Be prepared. Something is about to happen." Yuki stated simply.

"Whats going to happen?" Kyon asked her.

"I am unsure."

'Great. Well, its not like I didn't expect thhe peace to end eventually.' Kyon thought as he exitted the room. The rest of the day was uneventful for him, and later that night, he evetually fell asleep, ignorant of what his and the SOS Brigade's next little misadventure would be.

Kyon yawned as he reached over to turn off his blaring alarm without opening his eyes. He was thankful that for once his sister hadn't come in and woke him up like she usually did. It was nice to wake up on his own for once.

Letting out another yawn, he opened his eyes to a strange sight: He wasn't in his own room. "Huh?" He was currently in room that was unfamilliar to him. 154311112.content:
He saw the number on the screen was one he recognized well: His own. The name that came up was also labled 'Kyon.'

"I'm calling?" he said as he answered. "Hello?" he said into the phone hestantly.

"Kyon? Thats you isn't it?" he could hear Haruhi's voice on the other side. "I knew it!"

"Haruhi? Whats going on?" he questioned.

"I have no idea! I woke up in your room, and your sister seems to think I'm you!"

"What?" he questioned. He didn't like where this was going one bit...

"You heard me! And it wasn't just her. Your whole family thinks I'm you for some reason, so I just went along with things until I left." she explained. "Kyon, do you have any idea what this means?"

Kyon had a feeling he knew exactly where this was going. "It means that if everyone thinks you're me, then they're gonna think I'm you..."

"No!" she shouted into the phone. "Well actually, yeah, that probably is the case. But what I mean is that something really weird and interesting is happening to me and you!"

'She sounds exited...' he thought to himself. "So then now what?" he asked.

"Its sunday, so no school. Get dressed and met me at the usual meeting place! We'l talk about how this might have happened."

'But I already know exactly how this happened...' he thought. "Okay."

"And remember! You've got to prented that you're me since thats what everyone else is gonna think!" she said before hanging up.

He then glanced towards Haruhi's closet. "Damn it, Haruhi." he said as he knew what he had to do.
154311112.title: Getting a call from yourself?

1543111122.content:
Kyon sighed and went over to the closet. He looked at the clothes that were in the closet. All kind of skirts or short shorts. Unfortunately nothing that really would cover his legs. With a sigh he settled for a knee-length black skirt and a white t-shirt. Before he had put on the shirt he noticed that he was not wearing a bra. Nothing he would normally notice but with the fact that he was now seen as Haruhi in the back of his mind, he grabbed a bra that would match the panties he was wearing and then began dressing himself, struggling a little with putting on the bra.

When he was dressed he looked at himself in the mirror. He looked ridiculous in the skirt. Then he noticed a yellow ribbon on the desk beside him. It was the ribbon Haruhi usually wore. He sighed and grabbed it. It was nearly impossible to get the ribbon fit like it usually did with Haruhi but eventually he managed it. He hurried outside.

Outside he felt very self-concious walking around in a skirt but everyone thought of him as Haurhi and therefore did not think anything strange. "Haruhi is always creating a big mess and I'm in the centre of it.", he sighed and soon got to the park were they usually met. Haruhi, dressed in his clothes, was already there and began to giggle when she saw him. "You look really cute, Kyon.".

"Haha, very funny.", he sighed in his usual monotonous voice. "Do you have any idea how this happened?", he asked her but only received the shaking of her head. "I don't have the slightest idea but isn't this great?". Her eyes began to sparkle. "Maybe some aliens tried a device out on us. Maybe a time traveler changed us unknowingly with the time waves of his time machine. Maybe a magician casted a spell on us.".

Kyon shook his head when he heard all those theories she had. It were the usual ones she had when she could not explain something. The real reason was pretty obvious if you were not called Haruhi: It was her doing. "I think we should gather the gang.", Kyon suggested. "Maybe we can figure something out together.". She nodded, grabbed his former cell phone and called everyone in her usual cheerful tone. Kyon sighed. "They will think I've gon nuts.", he thought.

Half an hour later everyone had arrived and Haruhi had explained the situation. Mikuru looked at Kyon. "You're really Kyon?", she asked him in her usual sweet voice. The boy who was now wearing a skirt nodded slowly. Itskui looked at Kyon and Haruhi with his usual smile. "Well then. I think we should go home for now and see what we all can find out.", he suggested. "And you two should try to act normal.".

Haruhi crossed her arms infront of her chest. "What? But that's no fun!". Kyon looked at her. "But it's the best we can do. Running around and looking for god knows what isn't going to help us.". Haruhi sighed and gave in. "Okay okay...".

Soon the group disbanded and Itsuki went over to Kyon. "You think Haruhi's responsible for this?", he asked him. Kyon nodded with a serious look. "Hm... Okay.". Itsuki's face turned very serious. "I think you should just play along. If she is really the reason for this, she might get tired of it in a day or two and everything will revert back to normal eventually.", he explained. "So don't worry.". His ever lasting smile re-appeared on his face. Kyon just sighed, nodded and continued back home. Well, Haruhi's home.

Right before he arrived there he met someone on the street. It was...

15432112111.content:
The plan was perfect, in Genma's opinion. With this incense, Akane and Ranma would stop fighting all the time, accept each other's differences, and then the Saotome School of Martial Arts would be insured.

He set down the incense carefully in each room before darting from the room. He certainly didn't want to be in there when the magic took effect, whatever it did. His relationship with Ranma was great already!

The next morning, Ranma yawned as she lifted herself from the bed. "Oh great," she groaned to herself as she looked over her body. A girl again. "Nabiki better not have taken any photos while I was asleep."

Looking around her, Ranma couldn't help but notice something wrong here. Why was she in Akane's room? Nabiki's photos were one thing, but there's no way Akane would approve a set-up like this.

Her eyes drifted to a photo on the nightstand. A nice photo of the Tendo family, with Soun, Kasumi, Nabiki, and...
15432112111.title: Akane

154321121111.content:
Akane, right there in her standard tomboy attire.

Ranma rolled her eyes as she lifted herself from Akane's bed. "Can't wait for her to get mad at me for something I didn't even do."

She stepped out into the hall, only to run into Nabiki carrying some laundry. "Morning Akane. That husband of yours is at it again this morning.

Ranma could only blink in surprise. "Husband?"

"I know, Akane, he's only your fiance and you're not interested." Nabiki smiled that sly Nabiki smile as she continued down the hall. "Same profit for me either way."

What was that about?, Ranma wondered.

Just then, a familiar shout from the yard. "RANMA!"

"Oh, not again..." Ranma groaned as she rushed down the stairs. Fighting in Akane's nightgown wasn't exactly her idea of a good time. She reached the koi pond only to find....
154321121111.title: Its a normal photo of the Tendo family and ever...

1543211211111.content:
It was a normal scene. Genma attacking his son. His son striking back. A flurry of punches and kicks and blasts, over and over again. It was a scene the Tendo residence had scene constantly.

But this time, Ranma wasn't part of it.

Instead, Akane was the one meeting Genma's blows. One after another, without question or hesitation.

Ranma could only stare in shock. What... was happening? When did Akane get that good at fighting? And worse than that, why was Pops attacking her?!

He was ready to rush in and give Pops a beating when Kasumi poked her head out of the kitchen.

"Food's ready!"

Genma's eyes lit up, giving Akane the opportunity to kick the old man into the pond. "Out of the way, Pops!"

And with a confident, familiar swagger, she leaped back to the ground with a smirk. "Didn't poison the kitchen with your food, right?"

Ranma was spiraling. Nothing was right. Everything was upside down and flipped over. "What... what are you talking about, Akane?"

Akane stared at him in confusion. "What'd you call me?"

"Y-your name, moron!"

A look of genuine concern crossed her face. "Ya hit your head or something?"

"Maybe its because you keep calling her tomboy instead, Ranma." Nabiki was already digging into the meal, without a care in the world.

"Akane, are you feeling alright? Would you like to sit down?"

And, with creeping dread, Ranma realized all of them were acting the same. As if the situation was normal. As if he was the one acting odd.

As if he was Akane.

He stepped back from the porch, nearly tripping into the pond. He quickly raced over to the fence. "I-I'm heading to school."

"Wh-what?! In your pajamas?!"

"Akane! Get back here!"

Ranma ignored it for now. It wasn't his nightgown. It wasn't his life. He raced out to the streets, ignoring the shock on passing faces. There had to be a cure, had to be a cure, had to be some explanation for... all of this! Someone out there would helped him!

He was Ranma Saotome, dammit! He was Ranma!
1543211211111.title: Akane fighting Genma

15432112111111.content:
Running into Tofu's clinic in Akane's sleepwear was already a social nightmare Ranma hated dealing with. The good doctor was all confused and stammering and worried about what people would think. He insisted on Ranma changing into a spare school uniform Tofu kept for Akane, in the event of a martial artist attacking her on the way to school.

Thus began a series of complicated, horrible explanations.

When he finally finished, Tofu was resting his chin in his hand thoughtfully.

"...That's quite a story. A strange one but... not impossible for you."

Ranma sighed. It sounded like Tofu might actually listen. "Then what the hell do I do? How do I fix this?"

Tofu tapped his nose, lost in thought. Then he pulled out his notepad and started writing. "Magic isn't entirely my expertise. But it seems to me there are a few possibilities here. Perhaps a curse from an enemy?"

"I have too many of those to count..."

"Or a magical wish gone wrong. Someone wishing for something from either Ranma or Akane, that could only be filled by altering lives."

An image of Kuno with a wishing sword slammed into Ranma's mind. He shivered in disgust.

"If you're going to investigate the cause of this curse, you'll have to be careful. If you prove to be too suspicious, maybe this magician will curse you again."

Ranma crossed his arms, annoyed. "So, what does that mean for me? How am I s'posed to look normal when I'm not normal?"

Tofu adjusted his glasses. "By playing the part. Pretend to be who everyone says you are."

"Ya gotta be kidding me...."

"And maybe, this spell needs that too. Maybe some passing spirit or monster cursed you out of some belief that you'd learn a lesson. Maybe the magic wants you to understand Akane better."

Ranma threw his arms up bitterly. "I've tried understanding her for years! She's angry and loud and... weird! Nothing I do is ever right!"

"Then consider this a chance to learn. To live a day in her shoes. To find ways to avoid getting hit with another hammer."

...well, when he phrased it like that, it was tempting. Still. Ranma blew some hair of his eyes. "Are those your only ideas? Nothin' better?"

"...I have another, but you wouldn't like it."

"I'm not afraid of nothing, Doc."

The poor doctor sighed. "Perhaps, after years of being underestimated, Akane just... broke. Every morning until you arrived, she was harassed by dozens of boys. She had to fight to protect herself, with no help from anyone. After meeting you, suddenly she was always being saved. From your description of your morning, it sounds like she would always wake up to the sounds of stronger fighters brawling out her window. It would have been hard for her not to feel helpless. She might lash out at others in an attempt to make herself feel stronger, only for that feeling to be temporary. Perhaps, her desperation and fear of falling behind culminated in a complete disassociation. Becoming the very person she envied."

He took off his glasses, cleaning them carefully. "If that were the case, and she couldn't readjust to her actual life, she might require deep psychological counseling. If people learned about Akane's belief she was someone else, it could put her entire future at risk. She would be unfairly regarded as a nutcase for maybe the rest of her life.

A long silence stretched over the clinic. Ranma gulped. He didn't want to acknowledge that analysis, but a few words stung in his mind. If he wasn't careful... Akane's entire life could be ruined.

"So.... be Akane, huh?"

"Probably a good idea."
15432112111111.title: Find Dr. Tofu

choices: "Why was I in your room and what were you doing in mine?!"
154321121112.content:
Ranma blinked. No, that couldn't be right. Not at all.

What was a little, girl version of him doing in this photo?

He took another look around in shock. On the surface, it was still Akane's room. Stuffed animals, girly wallpaper and carpets, all that stuff. And yet... there was stuff here more suited to his tastes. The clothes scattered on the ground weren't just the school uniform, they were the kind of clothes he'd wear when he wanted to train or trick a shopkeep into free food. And that carpet was definitely more suited to training than it used to be.

She flung open the door. She had to get out of that room and get answers. Yet she didn't make it two steps before ramming right into Akane herself.

"Ow! Watch it, tomboy!"

Akane stumbled backward, glaring at Ranma in that typical way.
154321121112.title: Ranma has replaced Akane (and vice versa) and e...

choices: Improvise and pretend to be a Tendo
1543211211122.content:
"Cheap talk from the pervert girl!"

Ranma growled immediately. "What did you call me?!"

"You heard me! You trick your way into ice cream all the time! Don't you have any feminine modesty?!" She crossed her arms irritably. "And you're just a big a tomboy as I am!"

Ranma was beyond confused. Akane hated it when he called her a tomboy, but now she seemed more offended by the yelling than the insult.

"What are you talking about?"

"Look Ranma, just because we're both martial artists and fiances doesn't mean I'm gonna let the Saotome School of Martial Arts be run by a floozy like you. I trained for years with Pop, I'm not letting Ranma Tendo run it into the ground."

Ranma's mouth open and closed blankly. Okay. Think this through. Akane's still Akane but she thinks I'm a Tendo. Does that mean she thinks she's the Saotome heir?

What could he do to handle this situation...
1543211211122.title: "Cheap talk from the pervert girl!"

choices: Someone comes to the Tendo household
15432112111222.content:
Most of Ranma's problems could be dealt with by annoying Akane and it only got him hurt 90% of the time.

She put on a smug expression. "Look Akane, I know it's hard seeing someone as gorgeous as me-"

"Are you serious."

"But there's no need to be jealous. You'll develop someday."

She started sputtering angrily, face red in anger, before pulling a fist back. Thaaaaat's Ranma's cue to race away.

"YOU GET BACK HERE, RANMA!"

See, this was normal. This was something Ranma could understand. The problem was trying to figure out how to make the rest of this situation more of what she was used to. No one she was gonna be a Tendo forever. The Saotome School was her legacy.

But where to start?

154321121112221.content:
After Akane had calmed down, Ranma had to begin preparations for her school day. The stuff in her closet proved one thing at least: this version of him was a bit of a tease. She could swear the uniform was just a little shorter than usual, but she'd never paid enough attention before now to be sure.

She did up her hair in a ponytail before gathering her things and heading out with Naboki and Akane.

Out of habit, she tried leaping onto the fence, only to quickly lose her balance and fall off.

"Trying to be like Akane, sis?" Nabiki smirked in amusement.

"Heh. As if you could come close," Alane grinned, her ego taking a huge jump. Ranma's, meanwhile, was crashing downward. Too embarrassed to retort, she simply climbed back to her feet, grumbling all the while. That wasn't a good sign.

Nabiki started asking her about posing for some photos, apparently they had a more equal partnership in those profits now. Noticing Akane's annoyed expression, Ranma quickly leaped to dramatics, shilling her beauty and looks. Akane looked like she was going to lose her mind and tear her a new one.
154321121112221.title: Go to school

154321121112222.content:
Running from the angry wrath of Akane Saotome, Ranma gleefully races down the stairs, passed by Kasumi in the kitchen, and flung the door open.

She froze when she realized who was at the door.
154321121112222.title: Someone comes to the Tendo household

choices: Akane needs to be a woman among woman
Akane needs to be a man among men
1543211211122221.content:
Standing there in her usual graceful way, was Nodoka Saotome, wife of Genma Saotome.

Mom.

She smiled at Ranma easily. "Oh, hello Ranma. I was wondering if Akane was here today."

Right. Not her mom.

The words struggled to form but Ranma managed to spit them out. "L-Let me check!" And slammed the door in her face.

This was bad. This was really really bad. If mom was Akane's mom now, that might mean Akane was subject to Nodoka's same contract. Which meant an angry Akane coming down the stairs could lead to death.

She immediately flipped around and ran into Akane around the corner.

"THERE YOU ARE, YOU STUPID-"

"Y-Your mom's here" Ranma quickly interrupted. Akane's eyes almost bugged out of her head.

"Right now?!"

"Right now."

She started pulling on her hair. "This is bad, this is really bad..."

15433121.content:
It was another day at Duel Academy, and one that seemed to be normal enough. Jaden and his friends were currently outside the Slifer dorm, enjoying a Tag Duel between him and Jesse against Syrus and Hassleberry, while Chazz, Alexis, her friends Jasmine and Mindy, Atticus, and Blair watching from the sidelines.

"Go Jaden!" Blair cheered, as the duel was obviously over at this point.

"Go Rainbow Neos! Attack them directly!" Jaden called out as the fusion of his and Jesse's ace monsters did just that, and winning them the duel. "Gotcha!

"Man, I can't believe we lost! We almost had you two." Syrus said.

"Yeah, you guys did. The duel was great!" Jaden said. "Anyway, I'm still in the mood to duel. Who wants to go next?" However, before one of them could respnd, Pharaoh came up to him, a card in its mouth. "Huh watcha got there, Pharaoh?" he said as he took it from the cat. He looked at the card, seeing it was a spell card labled 'Life Swap' but other than that, it was blank. There was no description of the effect on it, and the picture was blank, and colored a solid black.

"I sense something strange coming from that card." Yubel said as she appeared behind him.

"Whats that card?" Blair asked as she and the others gathered around him.

"Life Swap? I've never heard of that card." Alexis said as she looked over Judai's shoulder.

"What does it do? The effect is blank." Chazz said.

"I don't know, but it sure looks weird." Jesse said.

"I think we should be careful. I've got a bad feeling about it." Jaden said. However, before he could say anything else, the picture on it began to glow, and turned from black to white, and the card emitted a bright light that engulfed all of them.

15433122221121.content:
Leo yawned as he and his sister headed home. They had just left Yusei's garage on their Duel Boards not long ago since he was going to have a duel with Aki. "Man, I wish I was one of them." Leo said. "Duel Runners are way cooler than our Duel Boards."

"Didn't you get Yusei to build you your Duel Board?" Luna asked.

"Yeah, but that doesn't mean its a cool as a Duel Runner."

"Whatever."

As they continued on their way home, something on the ground nearby caught Leo's eye, and he stopped his board so that he could see what it is. "Huh? Whats this card?" Leo asked as he rode over to it. "Life Swap?" he said as he read the card name.

"What have you got there, Leo?" Luna asked as she steered her board over to him.

"Its some weird spell card. Other than the name, the whole thing is blank!"

"Can I see?" Luna asked, and her brother held the card out for her to see. Suddenly, the card began to glow, and then emitted a bright light that engulfed the two.

154331222211212.content:
As the bright light died down, they noticed that they were in a different location. No longer outside, they were now back at Yusei's garage. They were currently standing near Yusei and Aki's Duel Runners, which both appeared to be smaller. Looking around, they then saw each other and saw they were now dressed differently

Leo was now clad in a familiar form fitting red and black motorcylce suit that left part of his chest exposed with red gloves and red boots with a low heel, and a silver device curled into the front of his hair. Luna now wore clothes that were just as familiar, with a form fitting blue jacket with amber gems on the shoulders over a black shirt with a red design, and dark blue jeans with similar amber gems on the knees, and brown boots and gloves.

"What are you wearing?" they both asked one another in unison, causing them to look at what they were wearing as well as their twin.

"What the? Why am I wearing Aki's riding suit?" Leo questioned.

"And why am I dressed in Yusei's?" Luna asked.

1543312222112121.content:
"How did we end up here anyway?" Leo said.

"I have no idea. We were on our way home on our Duel Boards, and the there was a flash of light, and we ended up here dressed like Yusei and Aki." Luna said. "Wait a second, do you still have that card you found?"

"Huh?" Leo asked, but quickly caught on. Unfortnunately, the card was not in his hand. "No. Its gone. But I don't remember letting go of it, and I had it before that flash..."

Luna sighed. "It figures you'd lose something important like that."

"Hey, its not fault!"

"Anyway, lets not argue. We should really try to find out whats going on here." Luna took a good look around the room, but saw no one else there. She then turned to the Duel Runners, this time paying attention to their size. "Hey, what happened to Yusei and Aki's Duel Runners?" she asked as she walked over to them. "How did they get smaller?"

"Huh?" Leo asked as he walked over to them. "Hey, you're right, they did shrink or something. They look like they were made for us rather than Yusei or Aki."

"Yeah..."

Just then, they heard the door to the garage open, and heard what sounded like Jack and Crow.

15433122221121211.content:
Before the two of them can think of what to do, Jack and Crow come into the garage.

"Hey Yusei. Hey Aki." he says to them.

"Huh?" Leo says in confusion. He can't think of why he would have said hi Yusei and Aki when the two of them are nowhere to be seen.

His sister though, is much faster to catch on. "H-hey Crow." she said. She wasn't sure why, but Jack and Crow seemed to think that she was Yusei and that Leo was Aki.

"Were you two just about to have a duel or were you just getting back from one?" Jack asks as he notices their attire.

"We were just about to head out." Luna says as she picks up the Yusei's helmet and puts it on. "Are you ready, Aki?" she says as sge turns to her brother.

Leo looks confused for a second, but catches on. "Oh, uh, right. Yeah, I'm ready." he says as he heads over to Aki's Duel Runner and picks up her helmet.

Getting onto the bike, Luna starts it up with no problem, and Leo follows her lead. "Lets go." she says and they drive out of the garage. She was nervous at first, but find that she somehow know exactly what do do, and finds her self driving as if she were an expert. Like this was her Duel Runner, and not Yusei's. "I don't know what going on, but for some reason, Jack and Crow, and maybe others think we're Yusei and Aki." she says to her brother as they drive down the road. "And I think it goes beyond that somehow. I think we've somehow switched places with them. I mean look at us, we're waering their clothes that seemed to fit us perfectly despite being much smaller than them, and then theirs their Duel Runners." she says. "What do you think Leo?" she asks, but gets no response. "Leo?" she asks as she looks behind her at the one following her.

"Oh man, this is so cool!" Leo said with a big grin. "I can't believe I'm driving a Duel Runner!"

"Leo!" she scolded.

"I heard you, I heard you." he says. "I'm just also enjoying this. Anyway, then if we've switched with Yusei and Aki, then where are the real Yusei and Aki? I mean, if we're them, than are they us?"

"Thats a good question." she says. "Maybe we could try looking for them. They might be just as confused as we are."

"Right." Leo agrees.

154331222211212112.content:
"Lets head back to where that flash was. Back where we were before ended up like this." Luna suggested. "It hasn't been to long, so maybe they'll be there or nearby."

"Sounds good." Leo said, and the two twins drove in the direction of where they had been before they were in their current strange situation.

It didn't take them long to get there thanks to the Duel Runners they rode. As they got there, though they didn't see them right away, they did spot them a bit farther ahead.

Riding on what appeared to be a larger version Luna's duel board was Yusei. Yusei was wearing a red long sleeved shirt with yellow markings under a short sleeved light pink jacket that matched the shorts he wore. He also had on pink and white sneakers, as well as a pink helme and a normal sized version of Luna's pink and white duel disks. His face was also lacking his yellow criminal marker.

Meanwhile, also nearby was Aki riding a larger version of Leo's Duel Board. She was dressed similarly, wearing a a blue sleeveless shirt with yellow markings under a short sleeved white jacket the shorts she wore. She also had on blue and white sneakers, and a blue helmet and a normal sized version of Leo's blue and white Duel Disk, and on her arm where her back claw mark should have been was instead Leo's own heart mark.

Yusei and Aki were both dressed in the twins' clothes, just as the twins were dressed in theirs. And like their larger clothes now fit the twins perfectly, the twins' clothes seemed to fit them perfectly as well.

As the twins got closer, they weren't really sure what they were expecting, but what happened deffinitely wasn't it.

"Hey! Yusei! Aki!" Aki said and waved as she saw the two of them coming up. She spoke in a much different tone that she usually did, sounding more excitable and childish.

"Oh? Did you two finish your duel already?" Yusei said softly, speaking in a gentle and innocent childlike tone, notably different than his usual tone.

To say this was a sureal experience for the twins was an understatement. Here they were, dressed like Yusei and Aki with people believing them to actually be them, and then here was Yusei and Aki, both of them in a situation that was similar, but they were acting like and believing that they really were them!

"Uh, yeah, we did. We were just in the area and saw you two and thought we'd stop and say hello." Luna said. She had been hoping that Yusei and Aki would be as aware of the situation as they were. The possibility that they might actually believe that they were really Luna and Leo hadn't occured to her.

Even Leo could tell what was going on in this situation, and he wasn't really sure about what to say. Then, he noticed something in one of Aki's hands. It looked like a card. Then he thought of something. "Ak-Uh, Leo, whats that in your hand?" he asked, almost calling Aki by her actual name instead of who she believed herself to be. He had almost forgotten that as far as anyone else knew, he was Aki for now. Still, it was so weird to be calling her by his own name.

"You mean this?" she said as she held it up, revealing that it was indeed a card. "Its some really weird card I found a little while ago. Its blank, and only has its name, "Life Swap," on it." she explained, confirming Leo's suspicions.

"Really? Would you mind if I took a look?" Luna asked as she got off of Yusei's Duel Runner.

"Sure thing, Yusei." Aki said as she handed it over to her.

Luna looked it over and Leo got off of Aki's Duel Runner as well and looked over his sister's shoulder. It was definitely the card that he had picked up earlier, and what they could only think had caused this situation. "Would you mind if I hold onto this for a while, uh, Leo? I'm curious about it." she asked, thinking to herself about how weird it was to call Aki by her brother's name.

"Yeah, sure, no problem. You can keep it if you want. Oh, unless it turns out to be a super powerful card! Then I definitely want it back!" Aki said, early jumping a bit in her apparent excitement as she said the last part.

'Sooo weird.' Luna thought to herself. "Sure. I'll let you know if I find anything out."

"Thanks a lot, Yusei!"

"Anyway, we should be getting home, Leo. We've got to go to our classes at the Academy tomorrow." Yusei said.

"Yeah, you're right. Anyway, see you guys tomorrow!" Aki said and waved as the two rode off on the Duel Boards.

"Did you find that to be as weird as I did?" Leo asked as soon as the two were gone.

"Definitely." Luna replied.

15433122222111.content:
It was a seemingly ordinary day, and Yusei was currently working on his Duel Runner alone in the garage. Crow was out on deliveries, and Jack was most likely at his favorite coffee place, leaving Yusei alone.

As he was working, he then heard the sound of the door opening. "Yusei? Are you here?" here could hear Aki say as she entered.

"Yes, I'm here. I'm working on my Duel Runner." he replied.

"Jack and Crow aren't here?" she asked as she looked around.

"No. Crow is working, and I don't know where Jack is."

"I see. By the way, I found this strange card on my way here." Aki said as she held out a blank spell card.

"Life Swap?" I've never heard of it." he said as he looked it over.

"Me neither. I just found it on the ground and picked it up, and thought I'd ask you about it."

Suddenly, the card began to glow, and then emitted a bright light that engulffed the two. Then the light died down, and things were obviously different for them. First, they had apparently swapped positions, with Yusei now standing where Aki had been and Aki standing where Yusei was. The second, and much more pronounced differece was their clothes.

Yusei now wore a red corset and skirt with short, puffy light green sleeves, and over the corset he wore a magenta coat. He also now wore black gloves were elbow length and thigh high socks of the same color and red high heeled pumps. Around his neck was a red chocker and a necklace with an emerald crested golden cross medallion, and rolled in the front of his hair was also a silver device. On his face, his criminal mark was not there.

Aki now wore a long sleeved blue jacket with amber gems on the elbows and shoulders and under that was a sleeveless black shirt with a red design, and brown gloves. She also had black jeans and brown boots. On her face was the yellow criminal mark that was now absent from Yusei's.

Both of them were now dressed in the other's clothes. And despite their different sizes, they fit them perfectly, as if they were what they were made for them.

As she took the sight before her in, Aki recoiled back in surprise. "Wh-whats going on here?" she sputtered out. "What just happened? And why are you in my clothes?"

"I have no idea." Yusei said, trying to remain calm and calm down the girl before him. "Just relax and lets figure this out."

Aki breathed in deeply, and did as he said. "You're right. Freaking out won't solve anything."

"Okay, now lets try to figure this out." Yusei said. However, before they can discuss things further, they heard the door of the garage open, and two people enter.

154331222221112.content:
"Geez, how many times do I have to tell you? Stop wasting our money at that damn coffe shop!" Crow yelled.

"And how many times do I have to tell you thet you can't tell me what I can and can't do!" Jack yelled back.

"Well maybe if you got a job and contributed to our finances it wouldn't be a problem. Oh, but wait, you can't hold a job. So stop wasting money on needless things!"

"How dare you insult Jack Atlas like that!"

The two of them shouted a bit more as they entered the main area of the garage. "Hey Yusei. Oh, and hey Aki. Didn't know you stopped by." Crow said. Neither him nor Jack seemed to react to their current attire. They both just continued their argument.

Aki was a little surprised and confused that neither of them found her or especially Yusei's state of dress to be strange. Yusei on the other hand, while embarrassed by being seen like this, wanted to investigate it further. "Jack was at the coffee shop again, wasn't he?" he asked.

"Of course he was, Aki! What else would he be doing? He doesn't work, he doesn't help out around here, all he does is waste the money that I earn!" Crow yelled, infuriating Jack and their argument intensified.

"Huh?" Aki let out, furthering her confusion. Why had Crow just called Yusei by her name?

'I see. So then they seem to think I'm Aki, and I would assume that they think that Aki is me. That would explain why they didn't react to what I am wearing.' he thought. He then glanced at the card in his hand. Ever since the flash of light, he had been holding the "Life Swap" card. Somehow, it had switched him and Aki's places. Just like its name said, it had swapped their lives. "'Yusei.'" he said to Aki, getting her attention. She was confused at first as to why he had caled her by his name but quickly caught on. "Lets leave these two to themselves for now. How about you and me head somewhere else. I was wondering if you could help me with something.

"Uh, o-okay." Aki replied

1543312222211121.content:
Leaving Jack and Crow to their argument, the two made their way out of the garage. As they did, Yusei didn't really pay much attention his feet as he walked, so he didn't realize something. Despite never having worn shoes with heels before, he had no problem walking in the 3" pumps that were now on his feet. He stepped perfecty in them as if he wore them every day; he walked the exact same way that Aki had when she wore them, one foot in front of the other and his hips swayed.

They walked outside and started to head away from the garage, though they weren't heading anywhere in particular. "So what are we going to do, Yusei?" Aki asked.

"I'm not really sure." Yusei said. "But from what I can tell, we've switched places. People think you're me and I'm you, and our clothes have been switched."

"How did this whole thing happen?"

"I'm not really sure, but I think it has something to do with the card you found." Yusei said, holding up the "Life Swap" card in his hand.

"I feel like this is my fault. If I hadn't found that card and showed it to you, none of this would have happened."

"Hey, don't blame yourself." Yusei said. "Its not your fault."

"Anyway, what should we do right now, Yusei?" Aki asked.

Yusei thought about the situation. They would need to try and find a way to fix this. But they didn't really have any leads on that, only the card that had caused it, and didn't know how to make it work again. They could try to find out more about the card. But without really knowing much about, they wouldn't really know where to start. They could just take it easy for now, but that had its own problems.People thought that they were each other, so they would have to pretend to be one another for now. Meaning he would have to go back to her place and act like he was her in front of her parents while she went back to the garage and pretended to be him with Jack and Crow. He didn't really want to, but if they couldn't fix the problem today, it would eventually come to that whether he wanted to or not, so it might not be a bad idea to start sooner than later.

They decided to take a ride as they left to talk. Luckily, Aki's was currently here for a bit of maintenance Yusei had finished earlier. Though first they would have to get changed into their riding suits. Or rather, each other's riding suits.

Exiting the room to get changed, Yusei stripped out of what he was currently wearing, finding that under the clothes, he also had a lacy pink bra that seemed to be made just for his flat chest, and a matching pair of panties. Ignoring them, he noticed on his arm, his mark was different. Instead of the dragon's head mark, he saw the back claw in its place. Else, Aki stood in nothing but a pair of boxers, and saw the dragon's head mark in place of her own.

Deciding to ignore it for now, he slipped into the red and black jumpsuit Aki wore when using her Duel Runner, noticing it only seemed to go up part way on his chest and left a portion of it exposed. He then put on her red boots and then slipped on her red gloves. He then packed up the clothing he had taken off into a bag to bring with him. Aki also finished getting into his riding suit as well.

Now that they were ready, they got onto each others Duel Runner and rode out of the garage, Jack and Crow still arguing. They headed toawrds the highway, though not really heading anywhere in particular. Aki also noticed that for some reason, she seemed to be driving a lot better than usual, even better than Yusei at the moment as she was currently in the lead of the two. For some reason, it just seemed a lot easier today. Yusei meanwhile was lagging a bit behind her, and noticed that he seemed to be having a bit of trouble driving, like he wasn't used to it, almost as if he didn't really have much experience.

"So what are we going to do, Yusei?" Aki asked as she slowed down and pulled up alongside him.

"I'm not really sure." Yusei said. "But from what I can tell, we've switched places. People think you're me and I'm you, and our clothes have been switched."

"How did this whole thing happen?"

"I'm not really sure, but I think it has something to do with the card you found." Yusei said, holding up the "Life Swap" card in his hand.

"I feel like this is my fault. If I hadn't found that card and showed it to you, none of this would have happened."

"Hey, don't blame yourself." Yusei said. "Its not your fault."

"Anyway, what should we do right now, Yusei?" Aki asked.

Yusei thought about the situation. They would need to try and find a way to fix this. But they didn't really have any leads on that, only the card that had caused it, and didn't know how to make it work again. They could try to find out more about the card. But without really knowing much about, they wouldn't really know where to start. They could just take it easy for now, but that had its own problems.People thought that they were each other, so they would have to pretend to be one another for now. Meaning he would have to go back to her place and act like he was her in front of her parents while she went back to the garage and pretended to be him with Jack and Crow. He didn't really want to, but if they couldn't fix the problem today, it would eventually come to that whether he wanted to or not, so it might not be a bad idea to start sooner than later.

154331222221112221.content:
Drving Aki's Duel Runner in the direction of her home, it doesn't take Yusei too long to reach there. Getting off and walking inside, Yusei calls out and says hello, but since no one responds, he assume's that he is here alone for now.

Deciding that his first order of business would be to get out of the riding suit he currently wore. Heading to a bathroom to change, he took off the gloves and boots and slipped out of it. He then opened the bag he had packed Aki's clothes into earlier, and with what would almost seem like a practised ease, dressed in them. Once dressed, he looked at himself in the mirror; at himself wearing Aki's clothes. This was the first time he was seeing himself after this whole mess had started, and couldn't help but think that this was more than a bit weird. But he knew that for now, there was nothing he could do about this, so with a shrug, he walked out of the bathroom to find something to occupy himself with for now.

As he walked around the large house, Yusei didn't really pay much attention his feet as he walked, so he didn't realize something. Despite never having worn shoes with heels before, he had no problem walking in the 3" pumps that were now on his feet. He stepped perfecty in them as if he wore them every day; he walked the exact same way that Aki had when she wore them, one foot in front of the other and his hips swayed with each step.

He eventually found that he had apparently absentmibdedly wandered to a specific room, and opening it up, he found that it was Aki's own. Looking around the room, one thing that caught his eye the most were the photos. He saw a recent one that he recognized, one that the group had taken of them all. In it, just like their current situation, he and Aki had switched places in it; he was wearing her clothes, and his pose and expression in it were the exact ones that Aki had when it was taken, and the opposite was true with Aki in the picture as well. And like that one, in all of the other pictures, he was where Aki should have been.

15433122222222111.content:
It was a seemingly peaceful and ordinary day, and as usual, Jack was currently at his favorite coffe place. Taking a sip, he enjoyed it taste. As he set down the cup, someone called out to him. "Het! Jack!" Glancing in the direction of the voice, he saw Carly.

"Hey Jack, check out this weird card I just found." Carly said as she handed Jack the card.

"Life Swap? Never heard of it. And why is ir blank?" he questioned before handing it back to her.

"No clue, but I'm gonna investigate it. Maybe I've found a great scoop!" she said.

Just then, the card began to glow, and there was suddenly a bright flash of light that engulfed the two of them.

As the flash of light died down, they both noticed differences instantly. While before it, Jack had been sitting at a table and Carly standing next to him, it was now Jack who was standing and Carly was sitting. The two looked in confusion at the other, and noticed the other thing that was different: Their clothes.

Jack now wore a long sleeved white and blue striped shirt under an open orange vest, and blue jeans that only went down to his knees. He also had on orange sneakers, and a belt with a pack. He also had thick glasses on his face now, and when taking them off briefly, he noticed he had difficulty seeing. Carly meanwhile was now wearing Jack's long white coat, his pants, his boots, and the rest of his attire.

"Huh? What the heck just happened?" Carly questioned.

"Thats what I'd like to know." Jack said.

Howevr, before they could discuss things, someone had approached the table.

1543322222222221212211.content:
Mako woke up not at home but in a jail cell with two other prisoners, male prisoners.
"Waah! Where am I?!" Mako screams with a start, jumping up. She notices upon landing that she isn't wearing her pajamas, but rather a delinquent's sort of outfit, much like her Fight Club uniform. Suddenly, she notices an elderly but muscular American man outside the bars.
"Mister Oldguy, get me out of here getmeoutgetmeoutgetmeout!" Mako cries, flailing around and begging the old man to let her out. He does.
"Huh, I thought I'd have to fight for you to get out of there," the old man says, dumbfounded at his grandson's uncharacteristic eagerness to leave. Before Mako can say anything, an American woman latches her arms around Mako in a tight hug.
"Oh Jotaro, I'm so happy you're out of there!" the woman says. Who is Jotaro? The old man drives Mako, the woman, and a muscular African man who was also there to a café. Not wanting to put an opportunity for free food to waste, Mako asks the old man for quite the comically large order, knowing he'd pay for all of them.
"So, Jotaro. I heard from your mother that you had a 'mysterious spirit' following you. And yet, I still haven't seen it yet. I had hoped you would reveal it back at the station." Mako notices he was looking at her when he said that. How did this guy know her mom? And what spirit? Had she been cursed and forgot about it?
"I have an evil spirit of my own, Jotaro. Hermit Purple!"
The old man pulls an arm out and looks at it. The African man sees something there, but not the woman. Looking at the arm, Mako...
1543322222222221212211.title: Mako's Bizarre Adventure

info.brief_description: The characters of your favorite animes swap lives
info.description:
The characters of your favorite anime swap lives with other characters from their series, or even another anime. No physical changes, just life swaps. Swaps can involve more than just two characters, and can happen more than once.

If you swap characters with ones from another series, then it can only be between characters from the initially selected series and the second series. Only two separate series. Don't want to get too confusing.

No sex, and don't end the story.

Have fun.
